metadata.description: Comprehensive assessment question bank for all 106 NIST CSF 2.0 subcategories

questions.question_text: How would you assess the risk from your current adverse event analysis and response processes?

options.option_text: No significant risk identified - comprehensive controls in place
Low risk - basic controls implemented with minor gaps
Medium risk - some controls in place but significant gaps exist
High risk - minimal or ineffective controls
Critical risk - no controls in place or complete failure

questions.question_text: What is the maturity level of your adverse event analysis and detection processes?

options.option_text: Optimizing - Continuous improvement with metrics-driven optimization
Managed - Established processes with regular monitoring and measurement
Defined - Documented and standardized processes across the organization
Developing - Basic processes in place but inconsistent implementation
Initial - Ad-hoc or reactive approach with minimal structure

questions.question_text: What is the implementation status of your adverse event analysis capabilities?

options.option_text: Fully implemented and operational across all applicable areas
Mostly implemented with minor gaps or limited scope
Partially implemented in some areas but inconsistent
In planning or early implementation stages
Not implemented or only conceptual understanding

questions.question_text: How effective is your adverse event analysis at identifying and escalating threats?

options.option_text: Highly effective with measurable positive outcomes and continuous improvement
Generally effective with good results and regular monitoring
Moderately effective but with room for improvement
Limited effectiveness with inconsistent results
Ineffective or not able to measure effectiveness

Mostly implemented with minor gaps or limited scope
Partially implemented in some areas but inconsistent
In planning or early implementation stages
Not implemented or only conceptual understanding

questions.question_text: How effective is your incident response management at minimizing impact?

options.option_text: Highly effective with measurable positive outcomes and continuous improvement
Generally effective with good results and regular monitoring
Moderately effective but with room for improvement
Limited effectiveness with inconsistent results
Ineffective or not able to measure effectiveness

questions.question_text: What is the risk level associated with your incident response management capabilities?

options.option_text: No significant risk identified - comprehensive controls in place
Low risk - basic controls implemented with minor gaps
Medium risk - some controls in place but significant gaps exist
High risk - minimal or ineffective controls
Critical risk - no controls in place or complete failure

questions.question_text: How mature is your incident response management program?

options.option_text: Optimizing - Continuous improvement with metrics-driven optimization
Managed - Established processes with regular monitoring and measurement
Defined - Documented and standardized processes across the organization
Developing - Basic processes in place but inconsistent implementation
Initial - Ad-hoc or reactive approach with minimal structure
